author: Special Correspondent
text:
To sensitise public on the need for road safety, the State government has allocated Rs. 65 crore towards creating awareness during 2015-16.

Listing out various initiatives by the State government, Ms. Jayalalithaa in a statement, said “though the State government has taken several accident prevention measures, accidents can be prevented only if all of us follow traffic rules. Everyone should realise it is the time for action and ensure an accident-free journey by following traffic rules.”

With the theme - 'Road Safety - Time for Action,' the 27th Road Safety Week would be celebrated from January 10 and 16.

The Road Safety Week celebrations on behalf of the State government would be flagged off by Industries and Transport Minister P. Thangamani near ‘The Triumph of Labour’ statue in Marina Beach at 7.30 a.m. on Sunday (January 10).
title: Road Safety Week from January 10
